Apologies for the confusion earlier. Here is a lesson plan for the 10th session of a digital literacy course:

Title: Evaluating Online Information

Objective: Students will learn how to evaluate the credibility and reliability of online information.

Materials:

* Computers or laptops with internet access
* Whiteboard and markers
* Printed copies of the CRAAP Test worksheet
* Online resources, such as news articles or academic papers

Lesson Plan:

| Time | Activity | Materials | Learning Outcomes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 10 min | Introduction | Whiteboard, markers | Introduce the concept of evaluating online information and discuss the importance of verifying the credibility and reliability of online sources. |
| 20 min | Instruction | Printed copies of CRAAP Test worksheet, online resources | Review the CRAAP Test (Currency, Relevance, Authority, Accuracy, Purpose) with the class and provide examples of how to apply it to different types of online sources, such as news articles or academic papers. Have students practice using the CRAAP Test by evaluating a sample online article and discussing their findings with a partner. |
| 30 min | Activity | Computers or laptops with internet access | Assign each student a different topic to research online and have them find two sources related to their topic. Instruct them to evaluate each source using the CRAAP Test and record their findings on the worksheet. Afterward, have students present their sources to the class and explain their reasoning for why they did or did not consider the sources credible and reliable. |
| 10 min | Break | - | - |
| 20 min | Activity | Whiteboard, markers | Create a list of tips for evaluating online information on the whiteboard, such as checking the author's credentials or searching for alternative sources. Discuss how these tips can help students verify the credibility and reliability of online sources. |
| 10 min | Conclusion | Whiteboard, markers | Recap the importance of evaluating online information and encourage students to use the CRAAP Test and other tips when conducting research online. |

Assessment:

* Review student worksheets for accuracy and completeness.
* Evaluate student understanding through a short quiz or class discussion at the end of the lesson.
* Monitor group participation during the activity.
